title: Icons & Idols: Where Does All the Love Come From? What's the Reality that Supersedes the Categories?
description:
Karen and Mark made it through 5 minutes of Jordan Peterson/John Vervaeke:-). 2:02:00 to 2:07:00
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DLg2Q0daphE&t=7653s

A play list of all ten episodes analyzing the almost psychedelic conversation: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLoARw9zo4EUYEEhM_KIgzl_eW9ZZTHbzh

Link to Mark on the 4 Ps of Knowing: https://youtu.be/Bu95C6cQ-jw

The 4 P's of knowing. Participatory into Perspectival into Procedural into Propositional. John says the new atheists have cut off the propositional from all other types of knowing. 

Situational Awareness bridges the value gap.

Perspectival is deeper than a level of knowing.

Propositions are navigated by the procedures.

Accepting or rejecting the icon because of what's behind it. (Perhaps because it's too scary or too dangerous).

If there's no observer, there's no object. The subject is subject to the object.The object is subject to the observer.

The ineffable, the Transcendent.
So, God is (says Jordan), by definition, what escapes our categorizing.

Negative theology, apophatic theology vs. God of the gaps. 

JBP and JV discuss icons and idols. JBP makes the leap that art is the icon and propaganda is the idol. Discussion follows on the various aspects of each, the differences, the potential for confusion.

Isaiah 44, Habakkuk 2, Psalm 115 (if you put your trust in it, it's an idol. "This will make me happy." "This will fix my problems.")
Biblical references to idols and what differentiates them.
